meanings.definition: An unobstructed and wide view of an extensive area in all directions.
meanings.sent1: The hiker enjoyed the panoramic of the mountains from the hilltop.
meanings.sent2: The tourist took a panoramic of the city skyline from the observation deck.
meanings.sent3: The panoramic of the park made the squirrel's search for acorns easier.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a panoramic of memories, each one vivid and distinct.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a panoramic of the beach at sunset, capturing every detail.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a picture or photograph that gives a broad view of a scene.
meanings.sent1: The photographer used a panoramic lens to capture the entire landscape.
meanings.sent2: The hotel room had a panoramic window overlooking the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The cat's eyes had a panoramic view of the room as it searched for its toy.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a panoramic display of his vast knowledge on the subject.
meanings.sent5: The author's words painted a panoramic image of the enchanted forest in the reader's mind.
